channel.title: What's best for web development?
channel.description: Your thoughts and feeling on web development languages and frameworks.

arguing over language-use is like arguing over brands, everyone will be set with what they already have and you cant convince them…

item.title: What's best for web development?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Ashi:

Well you’re posting things in favor to python saying it’s cool and what not.

Well, I guess saying “Python ++” means I act like I know Python.

Dogs ++ Amg, I know dogs.
Crocodiles ++ I’m an interior crocodile alligator professional.
++ ++ I invented the plus sign, dafahkyagonnado m8.

I love how you guys took my arguments seriously. I don’t give a shit if it’s missing a letter, lmao.

Read full topic

item.title: What's best for web development?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:46, topic:544242”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=663123.msg4432078#msg4432078 date=1403663544]

Every time The Web Guy argues anything, I just think about how I wish I could hide all of his posts.

[code]// ==UserScript==
// @name Hide The Web Guy
// @version 0.1
// @description enter something useful
// @match .moparisthebest.com/smf/
// @copyright 2012+, You

// @require http://code.jquery.com/jquery-latest.js
// ==/UserScript==

$(".bordercolor").each(function() {
var root = $(this);
root.find(".poster").each(function() {
if($(this).text().indexOf(“The Web Guy”) !== -1) {
GM_log(“Removing instance of The Web Guy”);
root.remove();
}
});
});[/code]
Crude but it works
[/quote]
I love you

lol The Web Guy talking like he knows python. else if is elif in python yet he’s complaining about rubys elsif.
You also don’t need semicolons in python just like in ruby however they still give you that option to use it.[/quote]

Lololol. Where did I talk like I know Python.

Read full topic

I love you

lol The Web Guy talking like he knows python. else if is elif in python yet he’s complaining about rubys elsif.
You also don’t need semicolons in python just like in ruby however they still give you that option to use it.

item.title: What's best for web development?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

The Web Guy:

Holy crap so many people on Moparscape are close-minded and don’t know what the hell they’re talking about.

How can you claim we are close minded when you’re the one arguing over a shitty pile of aids of a language? And to add insult to injury you claimed Ruby was bad because instead of elseif it’s elsif. Really? We’re the close minded ones? Okay.

Read full topic

item.title: What's best for web development?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:36, topic:544242”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=663123.msg4431999#msg4431999 date=1403627842]

The Web Guy:

No shit PHP is good for developing websites… -_-

++ That list was from a site with statistics, check it out if you want.
+++ Make a private server with PHP? Good luck.
[/quote]I never said PHP was good for developing websites. I said that, compared to developing anything else with PHP, websites are the most reasonable. I also don’t care where you got those “statistics” from, they don’t mean anything in determining which language is more appropriate for developing websites. And your comment about making private servers in PHP just shows you how crippled it is.

Just because you can’t make a private server with it, doesn’t mean it’s crippled… It’s made for websites. Maybe if you wanted to use OpenGL, HTML5, and JavaScript.[/quote]What about OpenGL, HTML5 and JavaScript? OpenGL and HTML5 are client sided. They has nothing to do with private servers.

Read full topic

item.title: What's best for web development?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:36, topic:544242”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=663123.msg4431999#msg4431999 date=1403627842]

The Web Guy:

No shit PHP is good for developing websites… -_-

++ That list was from a site with statistics, check it out if you want.
+++ Make a private server with PHP? Good luck.
[/quote]I never said PHP was good for developing websites. I said that, compared to developing anything else with PHP, websites are the most reasonable. I also don’t care where you got those “statistics” from, they don’t mean anything in determining which language is more appropriate for developing websites. And your comment about making private servers in PHP just shows you how crippled it is.

Just because you can’t make a private server with it, doesn’t mean it’s crippled… It’s made for websites. Maybe if you wanted to use OpenGL, HTML5, and JavaScript.[/quote]
You can use any language with a socket api for websites.

Read full topic

And your comment about making private servers in PHP just shows you how crippled it is.[/quote]
